Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the extent to which America's prison population is "exploding" compared to other nations.
Understate: The claim may understate the fact that America has one of the largest populations in the world, which could affect the comparison of its prison population to other countries.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that America has a greater percentage of its people behind bars than any other nation in the world.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the percentage of people in prison is the most accurate measure of comparing prison populations between countries, without considering other factors such as crime rates or judicial systems.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for why America has a high prison population, such as different approaches to criminal justice or social factors, which are not addressed in the claim.
